meanings.definition: The lowest horizontal timber of a structure, serving as a foundation.
meanings.sent1: The groundsill of the cabin was strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter placed the groundsill carefully to support the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the groundsill but slipped off comically.
meanings.sent4: The groundsill of the old barn held memories of generations past.
meanings.sent5: The groundsill creaked under the weight of history and time.

meanings.definition: The base or foundation of something.
meanings.sent1: The groundsill of the argument was the misunderstanding between the friends.
meanings.sent2: The groundsill of the project was laid with careful planning.
meanings.sent3: The groundsill of the cake was so delicious that everyone wanted seconds.
meanings.sent4: Trust forms the groundsill of any strong relationship.
meanings.sent5: The groundsill of success is often built on hard work and determination.

meanings.definition: The lowest part of a wall or building, typically made of stone or concrete.
meanings.sent1: The groundsill of the ancient castle was weathered but still standing.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully repaired the damaged groundsill of the building.
meanings.sent3: The cat loved to sunbathe on the warm groundsill of the house.
meanings.sent4: The groundsill of the tower seemed to touch the sky.
meanings.sent5: The groundsill bore the weight of the entire structure with grace.
